issues.title: Click the logo to go to Home
issues.body: I keep instinctively clicking the Kiwipedia logo to go back to the homepage, and am sad when it doesn't work :)

issues.title: Place the option for importing directly on the Not Found page
issues.body:
When I reach a page that doesn't exist, I get turned off when I read 'Want to create your own?'.

Not really, I'd rather import it. Only when reluctantly agreeing to create my own do I realize the import option is behind there :)

I suggest instead writing on the Not Found page:

# No article named theoretical-computer-science

[Create page](new-article)
[Import from another Wiki](import-article)

Just to clear up any confusion, as likely the primary way we'll be getting articles is through importing :)

issues.title: Importing Wikipedia page not working
issues.body:
I'm trying to import the following Wikipedia article: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theoretical_computer_science

However while it says 'Done', and that it's published to 5/5 peers, it does not redirect to the imported page automatically, nor does the page appear in the Article Index.

issues.title: Button to prefill Wikipedia address on Import page
issues.body:
It's tedious to have to manually find and paste in the Wikipedia URL every time we know we want to import a Wikipedia article. 

I suggest having a button below the 'Source' text box on the import page that says something along the lines of:

[Use Wikipedia page]

Upon clicking would write in the Wikipedia URL, with the language of the current hub. Of course these would need to be passed to the import page to do this.

Having a similar button, [Use ZeroWiki page], would also be preferable.

issues.title: White background goes grey when dragging open ZeroNet sidebar
issues.body:
Chrome v63, ZeroNet v6.0.1.

Dragging open the sidebar makes the nice white background of the page content turn into a dark grey. Perhaps you need to set the background color to white in the site's `content.json` as well?

issues.title: Auto-fill title when URL of Wikipedia/ZeroWiki are placed in import field
issues.body: When import URL changes, check with regex if it matches Wikipedia/ZeroWiki, then extract the titles and write it in the Title field ONLY if the Title field is empty, otherwise we'd overwrite something the user already wrote :)

issues.title: Don't let user create article with empty title
issues.body: Tell the user they're being naughty if they try to create/import an article with no title.

issues.title: Importing an article imports a redirect, however the article is not a redirect
issues.body:
I first imported `https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Directed acyclic graph` due to #4@1ENrYUYUHj6DcykKxnJmTJTppdQEwMPgSM, and it imported a redirect.

Next, I imported the correct URL: `https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Directed_acyclic_graph` and it seems to have *also* imported a redirect? At least, I can't navigate to the article even when I click the correct link on the article's multi-origin warning page.

issues.title: Typo: 'is doesn't exist' -> 'it doesn't exist'
issues.body:
Small typo on a template, found on [this page](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1KiwiBCVBUcuypVm8FEmUW9YT6fJDXkN9r/?/imported/en/https-en-wikipedia-org-wiki-directed-acyclic-graph/directed-acyclic-graph). 

Template r from other capitalisation was referenced, though is doesn't exist. -> Template r from other capitalisation was referenced, though **it** doesn't exist.

pull_requests.title: Fixed typo
pull_requests.body:
Fixed a small typo.

Remaining typos in the Hub:

"adding a new article to English version" -> "adding a new article to **the** English version"

"For latest version" -> "For **the** latest version"

issue_comments.body: Huh, you closed this issue but it still shows as open on my page. Is it because you added tags after the fact?
Ah yes, I think you're right. I'll create some new issues.
